title: What is phantom traffic and why is it ruining your life? - Benjamin Seibold

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe a traffic jam that occurs without any apparent reason, such as an accident or road closure?

options.label: A
options.text: Too many cars on the road

options.label: B
options.text: A minor disturbance, such as one driver braking slightly

multiple-choice.question: How do self-driving cars equipped with data on traffic conditions ahead potentially counteract phantom traffic?

options.label: A
options.text: By accelerating rapidly out of a slowdown

options.label: B
options.text: By maintaining a uniform speed that matches the average speed of the overall flow

options.label: C
options.text: By braking harder to avoid collisions

options.label: B
options.text: They are unaware of road conditions ahead

multiple-choice.question: What is the result of drivers accelerating too rapidly out of a slowdown in phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A
options.text: They reduce the strength of the traffic wave

options.label: C
options.text: They create another feedback loop that causes more stop-and-go traffic

multiple-choice.question: What is the impact of phantom traffic jams on the environment?

options.label: B
options.text: They have no impact on pollution

options.label: D
options.text: They are a minor cause of pollution

multiple-choice.question: What is the potential benefit of new technology in reducing phantom traffic jams?

options.label: A
options.text: It will increase the number of cars on the road

options.label: B
options.text: It will reduce the number of traffic fatalities

options.label: C
options.text: It will increase the average speed of traffic

options.label: D
options.text: It will reduce the number of self-driving cars needed to prevent traffic waves

options.label: D
options.text: A lack of interest or engagement with social groups

multiple-choice.question: What is the term used to describe the tension between two incompatible thoughts or ideas?
What is a common way people resolve cognitive dissonance, especially in the context of politics?

options.label: A
options.text: By seeking out diverse perspectives and evidence

options.label: B
options.text: By revising their beliefs to align with reality

options.label: C
options.text: By blaming external factors or convincing themselves that the inconsistency does not exist

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is a contributing factor to the increase in partisan polarization in recent decades?

options.label: B
options.text: The decline of traditional news sources

options.label: C
options.text: The trend towards clustering geographically in like-minded communities

options.label: D
options.text: The growing importance of local politics

multiple-choice.question: What is an effective strategy for resisting the distortion filter of partisanship, according to cognitive scientists?

options.label: A
options.text: Relying solely on intuition and initial reactions

options.label: C
options.text: Making a deliberate effort to evaluate information analytically and push through initial intuition

multiple-choice.question: How can warning people about potential misinformation help mitigate the effects of partisanship?

options.label: A
options.text: By increasing their reliance on partisan news sources

options.label: B
options.text: By making them more skeptical of all information

options.label: C
options.text: By encouraging them to seek out diverse perspectives and evidence

options.label: D
options.text: By reducing their motivation to evaluate information critically

multiple-choice.question: What approach can help make people more receptive to opposing viewpoints when trying to persuade them?

options.label: B
options.text: Avoiding discussion of values and framing the issue in a neutral way

options.label: C
options.text: Affirming their values and framing the issue in their language

options.label: D
options.text: Ignoring their concerns and focusing solely on presenting evidence

multiple-choice.question: According to the transcript, what is the ultimate goal of using strategies to mitigate the effects of partisanship?

options.label: A
options.text: To eliminate all partisan identities and affiliations

options.label: B
options.text: To promote a single, dominant ideology or perspective

options.label: C
options.text: To keep people better informed and capable of making evidence-based decisions

options.label: D
options.text: To reduce the importance of politics in public life

title: Why is cotton in everything? - Michael R. Stiff

multiple-choice.question: What material did the Inca use to develop their ingenious suits of armor?

options.label: C
options.text: By distributing the energy across a large surface area

options.label: D
options.text: By concentrating the energy in a single point

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: B

options.label: B
options.text: The density of the secondary cell wall

options.label: C
options.text: The thickness of the primary cell wall

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary factor that determines the softness of cotton?

options.label: B
options.text: The density of the secondary cell wall

options.label: C

What percentage of the U.S. dollar bill is made of cotton?

title: Inside the mind of a master procrastinator - Tim Urban

multiple-choice.question: What was the speaker's major in college?

options.text: To write it all in one night

options.label: B
options.text: To break it down into smaller tasks and work on it consistently throughout the year

options.label: C

title: Grit: the power of passion and perseverance - Angela Lee Duckworth

options.text: Passion and perseverance for very long-term goals
